alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 10:37PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A line of showers will impact portions of southeastern Camden, southeastern Pasquotank, southeastern Perquimans, and Currituck Counties and the southeastern City of Virginia Beach through 1115 PM EST... At 1037 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers along a line extending from Knotts Island to near Snug Harbor. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Currituck, Elizabeth City, Camden, Elizabeth City State University, Grandy, Weeksville, Sanderling, Indiantown, Corolla, Nixonton, Old Trap, Whitehall Shores, Knotts Island, Shiloh, Bob White Fork, Holiday Island, Poplar Branch, Glen Cove and Gregory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
